qas.question: What street in Islington boasts more bars and restaurants than any other street in Britain?
What is the longest street for shopping,, housing many shops and department stores, in the United Kingdom?
How long is Islington's Upper Street?
What famous high-end department store is located on Oxford Street?
Which world-renowned luxury department store is located in the borough of Knightsbridge?

context: Islington's <a2_0>1 mile (1.6 km)<a2_0/> long <a0_0>Upper Street<a0_0/>, extending northwards from Angel, has more bars and restaurants than any other street in the United Kingdom. Europe's busiest shopping area is <a1_0>Oxford Street<a1_0/>, a shopping street nearly 1 mile (1.6 km) long, making it the longest shopping street in the United Kingdom. Oxford Street is home to vast numbers of retailers and department stores, including the world-famous <a3_0>Selfridges flagship store<a3_0/>. Knightsbridge, home to the equally renowned <a4_0>Harrods<a4_0/> department store, lies to the south-west.
